title: App Guide
intro: Get started fast: add favorite places, understand the index cards, and enable only the alerts you need. This guide covers the key features and how to use them effectively.

sections.title: First Steps
items: Add favorite places to unlock quick summaries.
Learn the index colors and numbers, for example PM2.5, to understand risk levels.
Enable only the notifications you need. You can turn them off anytime in Settings.

sections.title: Key Features
items: Local air quality cards and map with essential weather signals such as rain, wind, and temperature.
Best time recommendations for outdoor activities using diurnal patterns and short-term forecasts.
Simple history and trends to track changes over time.
Bite-size articles and field updates in the News section.

sections.title: Usage Tips
items: Compare the next few hours to pick the safest window.
Use multiple places (home, office, school) to plan and compare.
When indices worsen, consider a mask, shorten your duration, or move activities indoors.
Pull to refresh on the Home tab to fetch the latest data.

sections.title: Privacy and Controls
items: Location permission is optional and used only for nearby info and relevant alerts.
Usage data is anonymized to improve the service. We do not sell personal data.
You can change or revoke permissions anytime in your device settings.

sections.title: Limitations
items: Weather and air quality can change quickly; measurements and forecasts carry uncertainty.
Low-cost sensors may bias under extreme conditions. Quality control reduces but cannot remove errors.
Treat the app as decision support, not the only source. Follow local authorities.
Data availability may vary by place and time.

sections.title: Feedback and Support
items: Send feedback via the Consultation menu on satucuaca.id.
Report data or bug issues with time and location details to help us trace quickly.
Check the Help page or FAQ when available.
